SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

ssui.fabbasi.collagedrawer
Interface Artist

public interface Artist

This interface defines the API for all visual elements which can appear in a collage, including elements intending to primarily provide visual displays as well as those intending to primarily provide layouts for other visual elements. (Note that all objects implementing this interface are expected to support and layout child objects. However, objects primarily providing visual displays are likely to do this in a simple default fashion.) Each Artist maintains a notion of it's position (relative to it's containing or parent Artist) as well as it's size. It's size may be determined intrinsically (that is inside the object based on what it draws) or may be set from the outside. Every Artist object is responsible for maintaining a possible list of child objects which are contained inside it. Finally, each Artist object is also responsible for drawing its own appearance, and for arranging for the layout and drawing of a set of child objects that appear within it.

Author:
Scott Hudson

Method Detail

setPosition

void setPosition(PointF pos)
Set the position (of the top left corner) of the artist with respect to it's parent's top left corner. Note that the position of an artist is most typically established by it's parent at layout time, so other calls to this routine may expect to often have their results replaced during layout.

Parameters:
pos - the new position of the artist

setPosition

void setPosition(float x,
                 float y)
Set the position (of the top left corner) of the artist with respect to it's parent's top left corner. Note that the position of an artist is most typically established by it's parent at layout time, so other calls to this routine may expect to often have their results replaced during layout.

Parameters:
x - the new x position of the artist
y - the new y position of the artist

setX

void setX(float x)
Set the x (horizontal) position (of the top left corner) of the artist with respect to it's parent's top left corner. Note that the position of an artist is most typically established by it's parent at layout time, so other calls to this routine may expect to often have their results replaced during layout.

Parameters:
x - the new x position of the artist

setY

void setY(float y)
Set the y (vertical) position (of the top left corner) of the artist with respect to it's parent's top left corner. Note that the position of an artist is most typically established by it's parent at layout time, so other calls to this routine may expect to often have their results replaced during layout.

Parameters:
y - the new y position of the artist

sizeIsIntrinsic

boolean sizeIsIntrinsic()
Indicate whether the size of this artist is intrinsic. An artist has intrinsic size if it determines it's own size. For example, an artist that draws an bitmap image might have an intrinsic size which is determined by the size of the bitmap. Artists which have intrinsic size will ignore attempts to set their size with the setSize(), setW(), or setH() methods.

Returns:
a boolean indicating whether this object's size is intrinsic (computed internally)

setSize

void setSize(PointF size)
Set the size of this object. Note: if this object has intrinsic size (which will be indicated by the sizeIsIntrinsic() method returning true), this call is silently ignored.

Parameters:
size - a point providing two values for a size (size.x gives the width and size.y gives the height)

setSize

void setSize(float w,
             float h)
Set the size of this object. Note: if this object has intrinsic size (which will be indicated by the sizeIsIntrinsic() method returning true), this call is silently ignored.

Parameters:
w - the new width of the artist
h - the new height of the artist

setW

void setW(float w)
Set the width of this object. Note: if this object has intrinsic size (which will be indicated by the sizeIsIntrinsic() method returning true), this call is silently ignored.

Parameters:
w - the new width of the artist

setH

void setH(float h)
Set the height of this object. Note: if this object has intrinsic size (which will be indicated by the sizeIsIntrinsic() method returning true), this call is silently ignored.

Parameters:
w - the new width of the artist
h - the new height of the artist

getSize

PointF getSize()
Return the size of this artist as a point. The x value of the point will provide the width of the object and the y value will provide the height.

Returns:
the size of the artist as a point (x gives width, y gives height)

getW

float getW()
Return the width of this artist.

Returns:
the width of the artist

getH

float getH()
Return the height of this artist.

Returns:
the height of the artist

getParent

Artist getParent()
Return the parent of this artist. A null parent indicates that this Artist is not currently installed in any parent object.

Returns:
the parent of this artist.

setParent

void setParent(Artist newParent)
Set the parent of this artist. Note: this method does not add or remove this object from the old or new parent's child list, it simply sets the recorded parent object for this artist. In most cases this action alone is not sufficient and should be accompanied by appropriate modifications to the child list of the parent object(s) involved.

Parameters:
newParent - the new parent of this artist.

getNumChildren

int getNumChildren()
Return the number of children this artist currently has

Returns:
the number of children of this artist

getChildAt

Artist getChildAt(int index)
Return the child object of this artist at the given index (or null if the index is outside the valid child indexes for the artist, i.e., is < 0 or >= getNumChildren()).

Returns:
the child at the given index (or null if out of bounds)

findChild

int findChild(Artist child)
Find the given child this artist's child list and return it's index. If the given child is not a child of this artist, this method returns -1.

Returns:
the index of the given child (or -1 of this is not a child)

addChild

void addChild(Artist child)
Add the given child to the end of this artist's child list. Attempts to add null children are ignored. If the given child is currently the child of another object it is removed from that parent's child list. If the given child is currently the child of this object it is removed from the its current position in the child list and placed at the end.

Parameters:
child - the child to be added to the child list.

removeChildAt

void removeChildAt(int index)
Remove the child at the given index in the artist's child list. Any children later in the child list are moved earlier (so the child list never contains "empty slots"). Attempts to remove non-existent children are ignored. After this method, the removed child should report a null parent.

Parameters:
indx - the index of the child to be removed.

removeChild

void removeChild(Artist child)
Remove the given child from the artist's child list. Any children later in the child list are moved earlier (so the child list never contains "empty slots"). Attempts to remove children not in the child list are ignored. After this method, the removed child (if any) should report a null parent.

Parameters:
child - the child to be removed.

moveChildFirst

void moveChildFirst(Artist child)
Move the given child so that it is first in the child list, moving other children further back (and "filling in" the old slot of the child so that the child list never contains "empty slots"). Attempts to move a child not currently in the child list are ignored.

Parameters:
child - the child to be moved.

moveChildLast

void moveChildLast(Artist child)
Move the given child so that it is last in the child list, moving other children earlier as needed and "filling in" the old slot of the child so that the child list never contains "empty slots". Attempts to move a child not currently in the child list are ignored.

Parameters:
child - the child to be moved.

moveChildEarlier

void moveChildEarlier(Artist child)
Move the given child one position earlier in the child list, moving other children later as needed and "filling in" the old slot of the child so that the child list never contains "empty slots". If this child is already at the front of the child list, this method does nothing. Attempts to move a child not currently in the child list are ignored.

Parameters:
child - the child to be moved.

moveChildLater

void moveChildLater(Artist child)
Move the given child one position later in the child list, moving other children earlier as needed and "filling in" the old slot of the child so that the child list never contains "empty slots". If this child is already at the end of the child list, this method does nothing. Attempts to move a child not currently in the child list are ignored.

Parameters:
child - the child to be moved.

doLayout

void doLayout()
Perform a top-down layout traversal of the artist tree rooted at this artist. This method should set the position each child object to create the layout strategy it enforces.

draw

void draw(Canvas onCanvas)
Draw this artist and all child artists on the given Canvas object. All drawing must be clipped to the bounds of this object as well as the bounds of all ancestor objects, and in general, must respect any clipping region already established in the Canvas object it draws on. The local coordinate system for the object will have been established within the Canvas prior to this call. That is, the Canvas transformation will be set so that 0,0 is already where the top-left corner of this Artist will be drawn.

Parameters:
onCanvas - the Canvas object that drawing is done on.
